results.title: Hard to Handle: Bob Dylan in Concert
results.creator_credit: Gillian Armstrong, Wolfboy Productions and HBO
results.headline_credit: Australia and United States of America, 1986
results.brief_description: In this concert filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions in a concert film shot by Gillian Armstrong.

constellations_other.name: Brilliant careers (Gillian Armstrong)
constellations_other.description: Gillian Armstrong's feature film debut not only helped launch her own acclaimed career, but those of the actors as well.

results.title_for_label: Hard to Handle: Bob Dylan in Concert
results.description: Admired as one of the best lyricists of pop rock, Bob Dylan has his name recorded in music history. During his four decades career, he has been through many facets: from acoustic to electric guitar; from politicized to religious lyrics; from minimalist to very highly sophisticated arrangements. And his characteristic voice, for some, hoarse and full of style, for others a little out of tune, still influences many musicians. In this presentation filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in Australia over February 24-25 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions. To close the spectacle, Bob Dylan and Tom Petty perform a vocal duet in “Knockin’ on heaven’s door”, one of the most famous songs of this compositor.
description_for_label: Admired as one of the best lyricists of pop rock, Bob Dylan has his name recorded in music history. During his four decades career, he has been through many facets: from acoustic to electric guitar; from politicized to religious lyrics; from minimalist to very highly sophisticated arrangements. And his characteristic voice, for some, hoarse and full of style, for others a little out of tune, still influences many musicians. In this presentation filmed at the Sydney Entertainment Centre in Australia over February 24-25 1986, Dylan is accompanied by Tom Petty and the band The Heartbreakers, as well as a very fine selection of new compositions. To close the spectacle, Bob Dylan and Tom Petty perform a vocal duet in “Knockin’ on heaven’s door”, one of the most famous songs of this compositor.

results.title: Happy Feet
results.creator_credit: Warren Coleman, Kennedy Miller Productions, Animal Logic and George Miller
results.brief_description: Into the world of the Emperor Penguins, who find their soul mates through song, a penguin is born who cannot sing. But he can tap dance something fierce!

constellations_other.name: There is no Planet B
constellations_other.description: While the climate emergency is very real, inspiring thousands and thousands of students to strike, documentaries, animated movies and dystopian genre films have warned about a world ravaged by global warming.

constellations_other.name: George Miller
constellations_other.description: For a guy who started his career as a physician, George Miller sure is a diverse filmmaker.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Warren Coleman, Kennedy Miller Productions, Animal Logic and George Miller
results.description:
You would’ve thought that the mind that brought cinemas the Mad Max series would also gift audiences with a feet-tapping, family-friendly blockbuster like Happy Feet. Trading the desert wasteland for frigid Antarctica, George Miller’s animated 2006 hit follows a young penguin on a quest to find acceptance. For emperor penguins, attracting a mate is a matter of the heart – or the “heartsong” – but for Mumble (Elijah Wood), who can’t sing, only dance, this proves an issue. Ostracised and ridiculed by the other penguins, Mumble finds a family with the Amigos, who love the young penguin’s dance moves. A story about accepting ourselves and overcoming life’s obstacles, Happy Feet also has a positive environmental message and was the fourth non-Disney or Pixar film to win the Academy Award for Best Animated Feature.

Aside from Miller, who directed, produced and co-wrote the film, Happy Feet has another Australian connection (besides an all-star Aussie cast) with its visual effects done by acclaimed Sydney-based animation studio Animal Logic – their first in a long string of hits that includes The Lego Movie.
description_for_label:
You would’ve thought that the mind that brought cinemas the Mad Max series would also gift audiences with a feet-tapping, family-friendly blockbuster like Happy Feet. results.brief_description: The Australian comedian Hannah Gadsby is taking an anti-comedy stance in her newest special.

results.title: Hamilton
results.creator_credit: Old 320 Sycamore, Nevis Productions, 5000 Broadway Productions, Lin-Manuel Miranda, Paul Tazewell, David Korins, Thomas Kail, Jeffrey Seller, RadicalMedia, The Public Theatre and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Presenting the tale of American founding father Alexander Hamilton, this filmed version of the original Broadway smash hit is the story of America then, told by America now.

constellations_other.name: Assassins: real world manifestations
constellations_other.description: Ryan White’s documentary Assassins breaks down the wild true story of the assassination of North Korea’s Kim John-nam, diving into the political and personal motivations behind the event.

results.title: Hair
results.creator_credit: CIP Filmproduktion GmbH, United Artists, Lester Persky, Gerome Ragni, James Rado, Michael Butler, Miloš Forman, Ann Roth and Stuart Wurtzel
results.headline_credit: Germany and United States of America, 1979
results.brief_description: Hair is a 1979 musical war comedy-drama film adaptation of the 1968 Broadway musical Hair: An American Tribal Love-Rock Musical about a Vietnam War draftee, Claude, who meets and befriends a tribe of long-haired hippies on his way to the army induction center.

constellations_other.name: Hell no, we won't go
constellations_other.description: The cultural, social, psychological and political effects of the Vietnam War have been explored through cinematic classics, musicals and comedies.

results.creator_credit_for_label: CIP Filmproduktion GmbH, United Artists, Lester Persky, Gerome Ragni, James Rado, Michael Butler, Miloš Forman, Ann Roth and Stuart Wurtzel
results.description: “Hair” is a 1979 musical war comedy-drama film adaptation of the 1968 Broadway musical “Hair: An American Tribal Love-Rock Musical” about a Vietnam War draftee, Claude, who meets and befriends a tribe of long-haired hippies on his way to the army induction center. Claude heads to New York upon receiving his draft notice, leaving the family ranch in Oklahoma. He arrives in New York where he is rapidly indoctrinated into the youth subculture before reporting in for boot camp.
description_for_label: “Hair” is a 1979 musical war comedy-drama film adaptation of the 1968 Broadway musical “Hair: An American Tribal Love-Rock Musical” about a Vietnam War draftee, Claude, who meets and befriends a tribe of long-haired hippies on his way to the army induction center. Claude heads to New York upon receiving his draft notice, leaving the family ranch in Oklahoma. He arrives in New York where he is rapidly indoctrinated into the youth subculture before reporting in for boot camp.

results.title: Green Bush
results.brief_description: An Australian Aboriginal DJ realizes that his job at the country radio station is about more than just playing music.

constellations_other.name: Broadcasting marginal voices
constellations_other.description: The creation of Indigenous broadcasting in Central Australia from the late 1970s meant an array of diverse Black stories could be shared. Today, important stories told by those who physically and metaphorically live on the margins can be broadcast widely.

results.description: An Australian Aboriginal DJ realizes that his job at the country radio station is about more than just playing music.
description_for_label: An Australian Aboriginal DJ realizes that his job at the country radio station is about more than just playing music.

results.title: Grass Roots
results.brief_description: Grass Roots is an Australian television series produced by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation between 2000 and 2003.The series is set around the fictional Arcadia Waters Council near Sydney, and was primarily a satirical look at the machinations of local government.

constellations_other.name: Bob Connolly
constellations_other.description: Australian audiences just can't seem to get enough of exploring local governments, bureaucracy and politics, whether that's through documentaries or biting social satire.

results.description:
Grass Roots is an Australian television series produced by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation between 2000 and 2003.

The series is set around the fictional Arcadia Waters Council near Sydney, and was primarily a satirical look at the machinations of local government. It was written by Geoffrey Atherden.

Part of the series was filmed in the inner west Sydney suburb of Concord. Many external shots of Arcadia waters Council chambers used Concord Council Chambers as a setting and as was other various locations around Concord, particularly in the shopping centre and cafes in Majors Bay Road. Beach scenes were filmed at Mona Vale, New South Wales on Sydney’s northern beaches, while the location “Cemetery Point” was filmed at the Mona Vale headland reserve.
description_for_label:
Grass Roots is an Australian television series produced by the Australian Broadcasting Corporation between 2000 and 2003.

The series is set around the fictional Arcadia Waters Council near Sydney, and was primarily a satirical look at the machinations of local government. It was written by Geoffrey Atherden.

Part of the series was filmed in the inner west Sydney suburb of Concord. Many external shots of Arcadia waters Council chambers used Concord Council Chambers as a setting and as was other various locations around Concord, particularly in the shopping centre and cafes in Majors Bay Road. Beach scenes were filmed at Mona Vale, New South Wales on Sydney’s northern beaches, while the location “Cemetery Point” was filmed at the Mona Vale headland reserve.

results.title: Good Omens
results.brief_description: Aziraphale, an angel, and Crowley, a demon, join forces to find the Antichrist and stop Armageddon.

constellations_other.name: Judy and Punch and many more
constellations_other.description: Women have been oppressed by patriarchal conventions and by men under the guise of the supernatural throughout history, but recent moving-image works are reframing these historical persecutions.

results.description: Aziraphale, an angel, and Crowley, a demon, join forces to find the Antichrist and stop Armageddon.

results.title: Golden Slumbers
results.creator_credit: CinéCinéma, Vycky Films, Bophana Production, Araucania Films and Davy Chou
results.brief_description: In Golden Slumbers, French-Cambodian filmmaker Davy Chou mourns the loss of lives and culture at the hands of the Khmer Rouge, but balances the somber material with a playfulness that honors the lush melodramas and mythic adventures of the glory years.

constellations_other.name: Bophana: cultural memory on film
constellations_other.description: Bophana Audiovisual Resource Center is dedicated to the collection, preservation and presentation of audiovisual material related to Cambodia. Their collection includes archival footage, newsreels, documentaries, feature films, photographs and vinyl records.

results.creator_credit_for_label: CinéCinéma, Vycky Films, Bophana Production, Araucania Films and Davy Chou
results.description: Over three million Cambodians died in the genocide between 1975 and 1979. The Khmer Rouge’s reign of terror also decimated a homegrown film industry that had flourished since 1960: movie theaters were bombed, film prints were destroyed and artists were executed. In Golden Slumbers, French-Cambodian filmmaker Davy Chou mourns this loss of lives and culture, but balances the somber material with a playfulness that honors the lush melodramas and mythic adventures of the glory years.
description_for_label: Over three million Cambodians died in the genocide between 1975 and 1979. The Khmer Rouge’s reign of terror also decimated a homegrown film industry that had flourished since 1960: movie theaters were bombed, film prints were destroyed and artists were executed. In Golden Slumbers, French-Cambodian filmmaker Davy Chou mourns this loss of lives and culture, but balances the somber material with a playfulness that honors the lush melodramas and mythic adventures of the glory years.

results.title: Glee
results.creator_credit: Bradley Buecker, Brad Falchuk Teley-vision, Ryan Murphy Productions and 20th Century Fox Television
results.brief_description: In this musical comedy, optimistic high school teacher Will Schuester tries to refuel his own passion while reinventing the high school’s glee club and challenging a group of outcasts to realize their star potential as they strive to outshine their singing competition while navigating the cruel halls of McKinley High.

constellations_other.name: Viral music videos
constellations_other.description: Gotye's 'Somebody that I used to know' was one of the internet's most viral music videos, seconded only to Queen Bey's 'Singles Ladies'.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Bradley Buecker, Brad Falchuk Teley-vision, Ryan Murphy Productions and 20th Century Fox Television
results.description: In this musical comedy, optimistic high school teacher Will Schuester tries to refuel his own passion while reinventing the high school’s glee club and challenging a group of outcasts to realize their star potential as they strive to outshine their singing competition while navigating the cruel halls of McKinley High.
